definition: to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful

sentences.english: To reform a man is a tedious and uncertain labour; hanging the sure work of a minute.
sentences.chinese: 改造人是冗长而无把握的工作，绞刑则是举手之劳。

sentences.english: I'm still not sure of certain grammar items .
sentences.chinese: 对某些语法项目我们无把握。

sentences.english: When in doubt, use brute force.
It depends on exasperating and uncertain instruments of persuasion and democratic decision making.
sentences.chinese: 手段是叫人气愤而且毫无把握的规劝说服和民主决策。

sentences.english: Consult your dictionary when unsure of your spelling.
sentences.chinese: 对拼写无把握时就要查阅词典。

sentences.english: He is not sure about the matter.
No way will I get involved with those dubious property deals.
sentences.chinese: 我将决不参与那些无把握的地产买卖。

sentences.english: This random approach is not as dubious as one might expect.
sentences.chinese: 这种随意的途径并不象人们所预期的那样无把握。

sentences.english: Smith is a good man for the job, but I'm not so sure about Robinson.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯干这工作很合适，但对罗宾逊我无把握。

sentences.english: I feel so unsure, As I take your hand and lead you to the dance floor.
sentences.chinese: 我毫无把握，当我牵着你的手带你步入舞池。

definition: to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
to hold on firmly/to cling (to a belief)/stubbornly
to shrink back as the time for battle approaches (idiom)/to get cold feet
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
Wanquan county in Zhangjiakou 張家口|张家口[Zhang1 jia1 kou3], Hebei
to beat comfortably/to win easily/abbr. for 穩操勝券|稳操胜券, to have victory within one's grasp
